name: Quality
description: Application to track perfect day and quality at gilt

model.description: The name of the model that was the subject of the event

action.description: Used in the event system to indicate what happened.

values.name: created
values.description: Indicates that an instance of this model was created

values.name: updated
values.description: Indicates that an instance of this model was updated

values.name: deleted
values.description: Indicates that an instance of this model was deleted

task.description: Describes what needs to be reviewed about a specific incident

values.name: review_team
values.description: Used in meetings to indicate that a team should be assigned to the incident or that the group should review the team assignment to make sure it is correct.

values.name: review_plan
values.description: Indicates that the incident plan should be reviewed and rated

publication.description: A publication represents something that a user can subscribe to. An example would be subscribing via email to the publication of all new incidents.

values.name: incidents.create
values.description: Email notification whenever an incident is created.

values.name: incidents.update
values.description: Email notification whenever an incident is updated.

values.name: plans.create
values.description: Email notification whenever a plan is created.

values.name: plans.update
values.description: Email notification whenever a plan is updated.

values.name: meetings.adjourned
values.description: Email notification whenever a meeting is adjourned.

event_data.description: Generic, descriptive data about a specific event

fields.name: model_id
fields.description: The actual ID of the model instance that generated the event

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Human readable description of the event

event.description: Represents something that has happened - e.g. a team was created, an incident created, a plan updated, etc.

fields.name: model
fields.description: The name of the model that was the subject of the event

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action that occurred to this model

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The timestamp on which this event occurred

fields.name: url
fields.description: The location to fetch more information about this resource, if applicable. URL will be empty in the case of events that delete a model instance (as one example)

fields.name: data
fields.description: Basic summary information about the object and the event. The intent is to use this data to quickly summarize the event - for detailed informations, callers should issue an HTTP GET to the URL

organization.description: Top level organization for which we are managing quality. Key entities like teams and meetings are scoped to the organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Used as a unique key for this organization that is URL safe.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this organization.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Defaults to a url friendy version of the name

team.description: A team is the main actor in the system. Teams have a unique key and own incidents

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Organization to which this team belongs

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique identifier for this team

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address for members of this team. If provided, used to send updates on new incidents, meetings, etc.

fields.name: icons
fields.description: Set of icons used on the site for this team (e.g. smiley and frowney faces). Teams inherit a default set of icons if not otherwise provided.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique identifier for this team

icons.description: URLs to key icons used through the application

fields.name: smiley_url
fields.description: URL for the smiley icon

fields.name: frowny_url
fields.description: URL for the frowny icon

statistic.description: Statistics on each team's quality metrics, number of issues

fields.name: team
fields.description: Team for statistics. Blank returns all.

fields.name: total_grades
fields.description: Number of graded plans given time span requested.

fields.name: average_grade
fields.description: Average grade for graded plans given time span requested.

fields.name: total_open_incidents
fields.description: Number of incidents without a plan for this team.

fields.name: total_incidents
fields.description: Number of incidents reported in the time span requested.

fields.name: total_plans
fields.description: Number of plans attached to reported incidents in the time span requested.

fields.name: plans
fields.description: Last plans to display grades for.

incident.description: A bug or error that affected public or internal users in a negative way

fields.name: id
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this incident.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Organization to which this incident belongs

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Summary of the incident.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Full description of the incident

fields.name: team
fields.description: Team responsible for resolution of this incident

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Optional list of tags to apply to this incident

fields.name: team_key
fields.description: Team responsible for resolution of this incident

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Summary of the incident.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Full description of the incident

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Optional list of tags to apply to this incident

plan.description: Details for how an incident will be resolved

fields.name: id
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this incident.

fields.name: body
fields.description: Full description of the incident

fields.name: grade
fields.description: Grade given to this plan on a scale of 0 (bad) to 100 (good)

fields.name: code
fields.description: Machine readable code for this specific error message

fields.name: message
fields.description: Description of the error

meeting.description: Meetings happen on a regular schedule (e.g. thursdays from 11-12 EST). As incidents are created, they are automatically assigned to the next meeting. Incidents can then be reviewed from the context of a meeting, facilitating online navigation. Incidents within a meeting can require one of two actions - team assignment or plan review.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this meeting.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Organization to which this meeting belongs

fields.name: scheduled_at
fields.description: The date and time for which this meeting is scheduled.

fields.name: adjourned_at
fields.description: The date and time at which this meeting was adjourned. This can be done explicitly by a person, or will automatically occur a few hours after the meeting's scheduled time.

fields.name: adjourned_at
fields.description: Defaults to the time of the request

meeting_pager.description: Used to enable pagination when walking through the issues in a particular meeting. General idea is given a meeting id and an incident id, returns the previous and next incident IDs, if any

agenda_item.description: Describe an agenda item for a meeting. Currently the only agenda items we have are that a particular incident needs to be reviewed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this record.

fields.name: incident
fields.description: Summary of the incident to review.

fields.name: task
fields.description: What needs to be reviewed at this meeting for this incident.

user.description: A user is a top level person.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.

subscription.description: Represents a user that is currently subscribed to a publication

fields.name: id
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this subscription record

operations.description: Search all organizations. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find organization with this id

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Find organization with this key

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all events. Results are always paginated. Events are sorted in time order - the first record is the most recent event.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Find events on this model

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Find events with this action

parameters.name: number_hours
parameters.description: Filter to events created in the last n hours

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all teams. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Find team with this key. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about the team with this specific key.
Create a new team.
Update a team.
Retrieve team statistics for all or one team.

parameters.name: team_key
parameters.description: Find stats for this team. Leave blank to retrieve all teams

parameters.name: number_hours
parameters.description: Number of hours in the past to retrieve requested statistics. Default is 1 week.

operations.description: Search all incidents. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find incident with this id. Exact match

parameters.name: team_key
parameters.description: Find incidents for which this team is responsible. Exact match

parameters.name: has_team
parameters.description: If true, find incidents with a team assigned to them. If false, find incidents w/out a team

parameters.name: has_plan
parameters.description: If true, find incidents with a plan. If false, find incidents w/out a plan

parameters.name: has_grade
parameters.description: If true, find incidents with a grade. If false, find incidents w/out a grade

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about the incident with this specific id.
Create a new incident.
Updates an incident.
Search all plans. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find plan with this id. Exact match

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Find plan for this incident_id

parameters.name: team_key
parameters.description: Find all plans for requested team

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Create a plan.
Update a plan.
Update the grade assigned to a plan.
Get a single plan.
Delete a plan.
Search all meetings. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find meeting with this id. Exact match

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: Find meetings where this incident_id is on the agenda

parameters.name: agenda_item_id
parameters.description: Find meeting based on this agenda item

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Creates a meeting. In general meetings are created automatically
Records that a meeting has been adjourned. Will return a validation error if the meeting had previously been adjourned

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The incident ID that you are looking at. Pager information will be returned including the incident prior to and after this incident, if available.

operations.description: Get information on paging through incidents (e.g. the prior or next incident in a given meeting)
Search agenda items for a given meeting. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find agenda items with this id

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: Find agenda items with this task

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Creates an agenda item for this meeting.
Search for a specific user. You must specify at least 1 parameter - either a guid or email - and will receive back either 0 or 1 users.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Find user with this guid. Exact match

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Find user with this email address. Case in-sensitive. Exact match

operations.description: Returns information about the user with this guid.

Used to authenticate a user with an email address and password. Successful authentication returns an instance of the user model. Failed authorizations of any kind are returned as a generic error with code user_authorization_failed.
Create a new user.
Search for a specific subscription.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find the subscription with this id.

parameters.name: organization_key
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this organization.

parameters.name: user_guid
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this user.

parameters.name: publication
parameters.description: Find subscriptions for this publication.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Returns information about this subscription.
Create a new subscription.
